org.mt4j.util.math
Class Tools3D

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.math.Tools3D

public class Tools3D
extends java.lang.Object

Class containing mostly static convenience utility methods.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

Constructor Summary
Tools3D()
           
 
Method Summary
static void beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa)
          Start drawing in on TOP of everything drawn previously, also resets the camera, so that something drawn at 0,0,0 will be drawn at the top left corner of the screen regardless of the camera used You could say this allows you to draw directly on the screen, and on top of everything else.
static javax.media.opengl.GL beginGL(processing.core.PApplet pa)
          Begin gl.
static void disableDepthBuffer(processing.core.PGraphics g)
          Allows to draw ontop of everything, regardless of the values in the z-buffer.
static void drawFilledBezierShape(processing.core.PApplet pa, Vertex[] vertexArr)
          Draws a filled 2d bezier shape in immediate mode with help of the stencil buffer to allow concave geometry.
static void endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa, Icamera camera)
          Stop drawing in 2D after calling begin2D().
static void endGL(processing.core.PApplet pa)
          End gl.
static int[] generateDisplayLists(processing.core.PApplet pa, GeometryInfo geometryInfo, boolean useTexture, processing.core.PImage texture, StyleInfo styleInfo)
          Creates 2 displaylists for drawing static geometry very fast.

Method Detail

unprojectScreenCoords

public static Vector3D unprojectScreenCoords(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                                             Icamera camera,
                                             float screenX,
                                             float screenY)
Unprojects screen coordinates from 2D into 3D world space and returns a point that can be used to construct a ray form the camera to that point and check for intersections with objects.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
camera - the camera
screenX - the screen x
screenY - the screen y
Returns:
the vector3d

unprojectScreenCoords

public static Vector3D unprojectScreenCoords(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                                             float screenX,
                                             float screenY)
Unprojects screen coordinates from 2D into 3D world space and returns a point that can be used to construct a ray form the camera to that point and check for intersections with objects.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - processings PApplet object
screenX - x coordinate on the screen
screenY - y coordinate on the screen
Returns:
a point that lies on the line from the screen coordinates to the 3d world coordinates

getCameraPickRay

public static Ray getCameraPickRay(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                                   IMTComponent3D component,
                                   float screenX,
                                   float screenY)
Constructs a picking ray from the components viewing camera position through the specified screen coordinates. The viewing camera of the object may not be null!

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
component - the component
screenX - the screen x
screenY - the screen y
Returns:
the pick ray

projectGL

public static Vector3D projectGL(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                 javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                                 Vector3D point)
Projects the given point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
gl - the gl
glu - the glu
point - the point to project to the screen
Returns:
the vector3 d

projectGL

public static Vector3D projectGL(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                 javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                                 Vector3D point,
                                 Vector3D store)
Projects the given point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.
Note: this method has to be called between a call to processingApplet.beginGL() and processingApplet.endGL()

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
gl - the gl
glu - the glu
point - the point
store - the store - vector to store the result in or null to get a new vector
Returns:
the vector3 d

project

public static Vector3D project(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                               Icamera cam,
                               Vector3D point)
Projects the given 3D point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the supplied camera, viewport, and projection matrices. The modelview is temporarily changed to match the supplied camera matrix.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
cam - the cam
point - the point
Returns:
the vector3 d

project

public static Vector3D project(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                               Vector3D point)
Projects the given point to screenspace. Uses the current modelview, and projection matrices - so update them accordingly before calling!
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
point - the point
Returns:
a new projected vector3d

beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen

public static void beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa)
Start drawing in on TOP of everything drawn previously, also resets the camera, so that something drawn at 0,0,0 will be drawn at the top left corner of the screen regardless of the camera used You could say this allows you to draw directly on the screen, and on top of everything else. (at the near clipping plane?) NOTE: you have to CALL endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen() if finished!

Parameters:
pa - the pa

endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen

public static void endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                            Icamera camera)
Stop drawing in 2D after calling begin2D().

Parameters:
pa - the pa
camera - the camera

disableDepthBuffer

public static void disableDepthBuffer(processing.core.PGraphics g)
Allows to draw ontop of everything, regardless of the values in the z-buffer. To stop doing that, call endDrawOnTop(PApplet pa) .

Parameters:
g - the g

restoreDepthBuffer

public static void restoreDepthBuffer(processing.core.PGraphics g)
End draw on top.

Parameters:
g - the g

printGLExtensions

public static void printGLExtensions(processing.core.PApplet pa)
Prints some available openGL extensions to the console.

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
pa - the pa

getGLError

public static int getGLError(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
Check for gl error.

Parameters:
gl - the gl

getGL

public static javax.media.opengl.GL getGL(processing.core.PApplet pa)
Gets the openGL context.
NOTE: If you want to invoke any opengl drawing commands (or other commands influencing or depending on the current modelview matrix) you have to call GL Tools3D.beginGL(PApplet pa) instead!
NOTE: the openGL context is only valid and current when the rendering thread is the current thread.
This only gets the opengl context if started in opengl mode using the opengl renderer.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
Returns:
the gL

getGL

public static javax.media.opengl.GL getGL(processing.core.PGraphics g)

Returns:
the gL

endGL

End gl.

Parameters:
pa - the pa

generateDisplayLists

public static int[] generateDisplayLists(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                                         boolean useTexture,
                                         processing.core.PImage texture,
                                         StyleInfo styleInfo)
Creates 2 displaylists for drawing static geometry very fast. Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
geometryInfo - the geometry info
useTexture - the use texture
texture - the texture
styleInfo - the style info
Returns:
the int[] Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

generateDisplayLists

public static int[] generateDisplayLists(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         int fillDrawMode,
                                         GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                                         boolean useTexture,
                                         processing.core.PImage texture,
                                         boolean drawSmooth,
                                         float strokeWeight)
Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
fillDrawMode - the fill draw mode
geometryInfo - the geometry info
useTexture - the use texture
texture - the texture
drawSmooth - the draw smooth
strokeWeight - the stroke weight
Returns:
int[2] array where [0] is the list of the fill and [1] the list of the outline drawing list

generateOutLineDisplayList

public static int generateOutLineDisplayList(processing.core.PApplet pa,

                                             java.nio.FloatBuffer strokeColBuff,
                                             java.nio.IntBuffer indexBuff,
                                             boolean drawSmooth,
                                             float strokeWeight,
                                             short lineStipple)
Returns the ID (name) of the display list If you dont want to use a line stipple pattern, use '0' for the parameter.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
vertBuff - the vert buff
strokeColBuff - the stroke col buff
indexBuff - the index buff
drawSmooth - the draw smooth
strokeWeight - the stroke weight
lineStipple - the line stipple
Returns:
int id of outline drawing list

drawFilledBezierShape

public static void drawFilledBezierShape(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         Vertex[] vertexArr)
Draws a filled 2d bezier shape in immediate mode with help of the stencil buffer to allow concave geometry. Beziervertices are allowerd in the vertex array.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
vertexArr - the vertex arr

Checks whether the given image is of power of 2 dimensions.

Parameters:
image - the image
Returns:
true, if checks if is power of two dimension

scaleTextureCoordsForRectModeFromNormalized

public static void scaleTextureCoordsForRectModeFromNormalized(processing.core.PImage texture,
                                                               Vertex[] verts)
For non power of two textures, the texture coordinates have to be in the range from 0..texture_width instead of from 0.0 to 1.0.
So we try to scale the texture coords to the width/height of the texture

Parameters:
texture - the texture
verts - the verts
